info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 23 at 10:59PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following county, Mecklenburg. * WHEN...Until 500 AM EDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1057 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Central Charlotte, South Charlotte, Southwest Charlotte, Northwest Charlotte, Charlotte Douglas Airport, Paw Creek, Steele Creek, Carowinds and Lake Wylie. Locations near Sugar Creek, Irwin Creek, and other tributaries of the Catawba River may experience localized areas of minor flooding. The headwaters of Steele Creek may also be affected. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
